sections.heading: What is Nai-form?
sections.content:
ない-form (nai-form) is the plain/casual negative present/future . It means "don't/won't do something" in casual speech.

食べない (tabenai) - don't eat / won't eat 行かない (ikanai) - don't go / won't go しない (shinai) - don't do / won't do

children.heading: 1. Casual Negative Statements
children.content:
With friends, family, in casual situations:

今日は行かない "I won't go today" 肉食べない "I don't eat meat" 分からない "I don't understand"

children.heading: 2. Informal Conversations
children.content: 明日来ない？ "Aren't you coming tomorrow?" 食べない？ "Won't you eat?"

children.heading: 3. Grammar Patterns
children.content:
Many patterns require nai-form:

食べなくてもいい - don't have to eat 行かなければならない - must go 見ないで - without seeing

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content:
Drop る , add ない :

食べる → 食べない (don't eat) 見る → 見ない (don't see) 寝る → 寝ない (don't sleep) 起きる → 起きない (don't wake up) 教える → 教えない (don't teach) 着る → 着ない (don't wear) 出る → 出ない (don't go out)

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content:
Change final -u sound to -a , then add ない :

買う → 買わない (kau → kawanai) ka-u → ka-wanai 書く → 書かない (kaku → kakanai) kak-u → kak-anai 読む → 読まない (yomu → yomanai) yom-u → yom-anai 話す → 話さない (hanasu → hanasanai) hanas-u → hanas-anai 待つ → 待たない (matsu → matanai) mat-u → mat-anai 遊ぶ → 遊ばない (asobu → asobanai) asob-u → asob-anai 帰る → 帰らない (kaeru → kaeranai) kaer-u → kaer-anai

children.heading: Special Case: う Verbs
children.content:
う becomes わ + ない:

買う → 買わない (NOT 買あない) 言う → 言わない 会う → 会わない 歌う → 歌わない

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → しない (don't do) 来る → 来ない (こない, konai) (don't come)

children.heading: Special: ある
children.content: ある → ない (not exist) (NOT あらない)

sections.heading: Complete Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | A-row | Nai-form | Meaning | | ---------- | ------- | -------- | ------------ | | 書く | kak-a | 書かない | don't write | | 読む | yom-a | 読まない | don't read | | 話す | hanas-a | 話さない | don't speak | | 待つ | mat-a | 待たない | don't wait | | 遊ぶ | asob-a | 遊ばない | don't play | | 死ぬ | shin-a | 死なない | don't die | | 帰る | kaer-a | 帰らない | don't return | | 泳ぐ | oyog-a | 泳がない | don't swim | | 買う | kaw-a | 買わない | don't buy | | 食べる | - | 食べない | don't eat | | 見る | - | 見ない | don't see | | する | - | しない | don't do | | 来る | - | 来ない | don't come |

children.heading: Present Habitual
children.content: 私は肉を食べない "I don't eat meat" 朝ご飯を食べない "I don't eat breakfast" お酒を飲まない "I don't drink alcohol"

children.heading: Future Negative
children.content: 明日は行かない "I won't go tomorrow" 今日は勉強しない "I won't study today" 週末は働かない "I won't work on the weekend"

sections.heading: Polite vs Plain Negative
sections.content:
| Plain (Nai) | Polite (Masen) | Meaning | | ----------- | -------------- | ---------- | | 食べない | 食べません | don't eat | | 行かない | 行きません | don't go | | しない | しません | don't do | | 来ない | 来ません | don't come | | 見ない | 見ません | don't see |

Use nai-form in casual situations!

children.heading: 1. Don't Have To (～なくてもいい)
children.content: 食べなくてもいい "You don't have to eat" 行かなくてもいいよ "You don't have to go" 勉強しなくてもいい "You don't have to study"

children.heading: 2. Must (～なければならない / ～なきゃ)
children.content: 勉強しなければならない "I must study" 行かなきゃ "I gotta go" (casual) 食べなきゃいけない "I have to eat"

children.heading: 3. Without Doing (～ないで)
children.content: 朝ご飯を食べないで学校に行った "I went to school without eating breakfast" 何も言わないで帰った "I left without saying anything"

children.heading: 4. If You Don't (～ないと)
children.content: 急がないと！ "If we don't hurry! / We gotta hurry!" 勉強しないと試験に落ちる "If you don't study, you'll fail the exam"

children.heading: 5. Negative Requests (～ないで)
children.content: 行かないで "Don't go" 泣かないで "Don't cry" 忘れないで "Don't forget"

sections.heading: Question Form
sections.content:
Use rising intonation:

食べない？ "Won't you eat? / Don't you eat?" 行かない？ "Won't you go? / Aren't you going?" 分からない？ "Don't you understand?"

sections.heading: Answering Negative Questions
sections.content:
Japanese yes/no can be tricky:

Q: 肉を食べない？ "Don't you eat meat?" A: うん、食べない "Right, I don't eat it" (Agreeing with negative) A: ううん、食べる "No, I do eat it" (Disagreeing with negative)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong A-row Conjugation
children.content: Wrong: 書く → 書くない ❌ Right: 書く → 書かない ✓ Wrong: 読む → 読むない ❌ Right: 読む → 読まない ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: う Verbs
children.content: Wrong: 買う → 買あない ❌ Right: 買う → 買わない ✓ Wrong: 言う → 言あない ❌ Right: 言う → 言わない ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using with Polite Suffix
children.content: Wrong: 食べないます ❌ Right: 食べません ✓ (polite) Right: 食べない ✓ (plain)

children.heading: Mistake 4: ある Exception
children.content: Wrong: あらない ❌ Right: ない ✓ 時間がない "There's no time"

children.heading: For Godan Verbs:
children.content:
Find the u-sound Change to a-sound Add ない

Example: 読む (yomu)

u-sound: む (mu) a-sound: ま (ma) Result: 読まない (yomanai)

children.heading: For Ichidan Verbs:
children.content:
Drop る Add ない

Example: 食べる (taberu)

Drop る: 食べ Result: 食べない (tabenai)

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: 明日映画見ない？ "Want to see a movie tomorrow?" B: ごめん、明日は行けない "Sorry, I can't go tomorrow" A: じゃあ、週末は？ "Then, how about the weekend?" B: 週末はいいよ！ "The weekend is good!"

children.heading: Example 2: Food Preferences
children.content: A: 納豆食べる？ "Do you eat natto?" B: ううん、食べない。苦手 "No, I don't. I don't like it" A: そうなんだ。じゃあ、寿司は？ "I see. Then, sushi?" B: 寿司は好き！ "I like sushi!"

children.heading: Example 3: Daily Habits
children.content: A: 毎日運動する？ "Do you exercise every day?" B: ううん、しない。時々だけ "No, I don't. Only sometimes" A: そっか。僕も毎日はしない "I see. I don't do it every day either"

sections.heading: With Frequency Words
sections.content: ぜんぜん食べない "I don't eat at all" あまり飲まない "I don't drink much" ほとんど行かない "I hardly go" めったに見ない "I rarely watch" 全く分からない "I don't understand at all"

sections.heading: Common Expressions
sections.content: 知らない - don't know 分からない - don't understand できない - can't do いらない - don't need いない - not here/don't exist (animate) ない - not exist (inanimate)

children.heading: Examples
children.content: それ知らない "I don't know that" 意味が分からない "I don't understand the meaning" 日本語ができない "I can't speak Japanese" お金がない "I don't have money" 時間がない "I don't have time"

sections.heading: Nai-form as Adjective
sections.content:
Nai-form conjugates like an い-adjective:

Present: 食べない Past: 食べなかった Te-form: 食べなくて

More on this in Nakatta Form .

sections.heading: Double Negatives
sections.content: 食べなくはない "It's not that I don't eat" (= I do eat sometimes) 嫌いではない "I don't dislike it" (= I kind of like it)

sections.heading: Nai-form in Compound Sentences
sections.content: 雨が降らないから、出かける "Because it's not raining, I'll go out" 分からないので、教えてください "I don't understand, so please teach me" 食べないけど、飲む "I won't eat, but I'll drink"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Nai-form = plain negative present/future ✓ Godan: change u→a + ない ✓ Ichidan: drop る + ない ✓ Irregular: する → しない, 来る → 来ない ✓ Special: ある → ない ✓ う verbs: う → わない ✓ Used in casual speech and grammar patterns ✓ Essential for intermediate grammar

Master nai-form - it's crucial for natural Japanese!
